definition: to clench one's teeth/to grind the teeth/gnaw
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth

sentences.english: I'd rather have seen him gnash his teeth than smile so.
sentences.chinese: 我宁可看他咬牙也不愿看这样的笑。

sentences.english: It was as if the Night sang dirges with clenched teeth.
sentences.chinese: 那仿佛是夜神正在那儿咬牙切齿地唱挽歌。

sentences.english: Determined, the blonde turned and headed for the swamps, set on catching herself an alligator.
sentences.chinese: 女郎咬咬牙，回身向沼泽地走去，准备亲手抓只鳄鱼。

sentences.english: After sterilization let teether cool down before use.
sentences.chinese: 灭菌后，让咬牙冷却后再使用。

sentences.english: It also involves howls of exasperation cursing and gnashing of teeth.
sentences.chinese: 还包括愤激的狂笑诅咒和咬牙切齿。

sentences.english: Bury your talents, and you get “weeping and gnashing ofteeth.”
sentences.chinese: 埋藏自己的才能，你将“哭泣并咬牙切齿”。

sentences.english: The gentleman gnashed his teeth when he saw the damage to his new car.
sentences.chinese: 那位先生看到他的新车被弄坏了，气得咬牙切齿。

sentences.english: “Orange, ” Hattie hissed, nudging me hard in the ribs.
sentences.chinese: “橙色，”海蒂咬牙切齿地说，使劲捅我的肋骨。

sentences.english: She could hate as passionately as she could love.
sentences.chinese: 她能恨得咬牙切齿，也能爱得一往情深。

sentences.english: Or a delivery with their teeth sharp touch Nano-imprint lithography drum slot in the side of the sound.
sentences.chinese: 或者是播纸咬牙牙尖碰不抬印滚筒不满档边的不韵音。

sentences.english: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 恶人设谋害义人，又向他咬牙。

sentences.english: Bite to plan to buy two books return to seeing at to dissipate sorrows.
sentences.chinese: 咬咬牙打算买两本书回去看着解闷。

sentences.english: I bite the persisted, I finally boarded the eighth beacon.
sentences.chinese: 我咬牙坚持着，我终于登上了第八个烽火台。

sentences.english: Stress-management techniques can also help you keep from clenching.
sentences.chinese: 这个压力管理技术能帮你解决紧咬牙齿的问题。

sentences.english: Hearing this, the son clinched his teeth and summoned up his courage.
sentences.chinese: 听了这话，儿子咬了咬牙，终于鼓起了勇气。

definition: lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
to steel oneself/to harden one's heart
